smart_goals.description: Reduce blood glucose level to 100 mg/dL by the end of the month.
Eat a balanced diet for one week to maintain a healthy weight.
Exercise for at least 30 minutes a day, five days a week to lower blood sugar levels.
Take insulin as prescribed, at the correct time, and in the right amount to manage blood sugar levels.
Limit alcohol intake to one drink per day to prevent low blood sugar and reduce the risk of complications.
Monitor blood sugar levels regularly and track them in a logbook to identify patterns and adjust treatment as needed.
Manage stress through meditation, exercise, or other relaxation techniques to prevent blood sugar fluctuations and improve overall health.
Schedule regular appointments with healthcare providers to monitor blood sugar levels, adjust treatment as needed, and discuss any concerns.
